summary: on this mothers day please consider thinking about carol danvers helping a young monica make a surprised mother’s day gift for...
body:
on this mothers day please consider thinking about carol danvers helping a young monica make a surprised mother’s day gift for maria (some sort of macaroni craft or general giant paint mess that maria will make carol help clean up) because maria is an amazing mother and it’s what she deserves. and of course it’s wonderful and maria loves it and hangs it up and monica and carol are very proud. 

and then as carol is finishing cleaning monica comes over and tugs on her shirt and carol smiles and she says “hey lieutenant trouble. you got something for me?” and monica hands her a mother’s day card that she made for her because “you’re basically my mom too, auntie carol” and carol loves it and hangs it on the fridge next to maria’s present 

and then, when she returns to earth in captain marvel, she later finds it in the box of things maria and monica saved for her and full on sobs because she didn’t realize how much she could miss her family even though she hadn’t remembered them

summary: Don’t Be Gone Too Long Part 3
title: Don’t Be Gone Too Long Part 3
body:
Summary: Regan is a witch living in Louisiana. Her ability to connect with the dead, and a few things from her past, have suddenly made her the Avengers last hope in resolving their issues. But can they help her reconnect with the person she wants to see most?

Pairing: Pre-established Carol Danvers/OC

A/N: So this is obviously where we start getting into Endgame spoiler territory. Before I saw it I wasn’t sure how I would fit Regan into all of this, but now seeing Carol’s story line in the movie I really won’t have to worry much…:)


Carol wasn’t sure how long it had been since she left Earth along with the Skrulls. Time passed by differently for her while she was travelling through the galaxies. It felt like she had barely found a place that she and Talos deemed safe before Skrulls started to disappear right before her eyes with no explanation. Then her beeper went off. Carol was quick to to assume that maybe something similar was happening back on Earth.

She made Talos promise that he would stay put and watch those who had survived while she got to the bottom of things. Nick seemed to be safe at the very least, but the thought of Regan turning to dust sent panic through Carol. She had promised her that she would be back before she knew it, and now there was a chance that she’d never see her again.

The signal was coming from New York. Carol didn’t recognize the building that was standing before her, or the large A that adorned its side. Was this part of SHIELD? Whatever it was it seemed empty. She was quick to take in her surroundings for any sign of danger, but Carol didn’t see a sign of much of anything. It would make getting inside easy at least. No real security. It was a compound of some kind, that much she could tell. Government maybe? Whatever it was, the place was like a ghost town. Someone had to have sent her the distress signal, but now Carol wasn’t sure if there was anyone left for her to help.

“What does that mean? Is it dead?” Carol stopped when she heard the woman’s voice. It was coming from somewhere down the hall. Relief washed over Carol. She walked down the hallway quickly, coming to a large room that she quickly realized was a lab of some kind. There was a group of people with their backs turned towards her…and a raccoon? Carol frowned, her head tilting to the side as she walked up to the group. They were crowded around Nick’s beeper, but there was no Nick in sight.

“…Where’s Nick?” she asked, her head held high. The group turned around almost in perfect sync. Each of them were on high alert and ready to attack. All but one. Carol exhaled slowly. Her arms dropped to her sides. Regan stood at the head of the group. Her long, red hair was tied up in a mess on top of her head and she was in her pajamas for some reason, but she was there. She was safe.

They moved at the same time. In just a few quick strides Carol met Regan at the center of the room. She took Regan’s face in her gloved hands, running her thumb over the witch’s cheek almost as if to make sure she was really there. Regan grasped at Carol’s arms, her eyes brimming with tears. “Sorry I took so long.” Carol breathed, leaning forward and capturing Regan’s lips with her own. Neither of them cared about the group standing there awkwardly watching the display of affection. Carol cared about nothing other than holding onto Regan as tightly as possible, and the salty taste of her tears on her lips.

“…Is that Carol?” someone whispered behind them. Regan laughed lightly, pulling away from Carol finally and turning back to the group.

“Yes, Bruce. This is Carol,” she stood beside the blonde, her hands wrapping around one of Carol’s. ‘And these are the Avengers. They’re with Nick.” she explained. Carol looked over the team briefly, her eyes narrowing a little.

“Where is Nick?” she asked.

Steve gave a passing glance to Natasha, tucking his hands into his pockets awkwardly. “He’s…gone. He was taken with the Snap. He must have had just enough time to send you the signal before he…well, we’re not really sure what’s happened.”

Carol’s jaw clenched for a brief moment. Regan gave her hand a tight squeeze. She wanted to reassure her that everything would be okay. She wanted to tell Carol that they would fix this, and get Nick back. But she couldn’t make that promise. There was a chance that everything wouldn’t be okay. “Who did this?” Carol asked.

“A big purple bastard named Thanos.” it as Rocket that answered.

Carol looked down at him, eyebrows raised in surprise. “You can talk?”

“Of course I can talk. Why’s everyone always so surprised I can talk?” he asked, shooting an incredulous look up at Bruce. Bruce could only shrug.

“I was actually explaining it all to Regan before you got here,” Bruce began. “I can fill you in, get you up to speed. Maybe fill you in on everything you’ve missed while you were gone.” he offered.

Carol shot Regan and Bruce confused looks. “What do you mean? How long could I have been gone?”

“…Twenty four years.” Regan said quietly.

“What?”

“Yeah, this might take awhile…” Bruce mumbled, rubbing the back of his neck.

—

It was late now. Regan was finding it hard to believe that it had only been 24 hours since Steve and Natasha had shown up at her door. Bruce explained the Infinity Stones and their powers to Carol, as well as explaining her connection to them. Everyone seemed to think there was a real chance of reversing what Thanos had done. With Carol on their side it seemed like she would make their plan run more smoothly.

And while Regan was over the moon to have Carol back, she couldn’t help but feel a little useless now. There wasn’t much she could do to help. Well, on the saving the universe front. She would always be able to help pull Carol out of a funk.

They were both in Regan’s room for the night. Everyone was turning in so they could get an early start the next morning and begin strategizing. Carol was in bed, staring up at the ceiling quietly. Kit and Molly were curled up at the foot of the bed. “I feel like as soon as I get my bearings everything gets turned upside down again,” Carol said suddenly.

Regan turned to her, setting her bag down and sitting on the edge of the bed. “I thought I was only gone for a week at the most. A week. And now half of the entire universe is gone? Nick is gone…”

Regan slid into the bed next to Carol, resting her head on her hand. “Please tell me you’re not blaming yourself for this, Carol.”

Carol was silent for a long moment. “…Not entirely. But if I had been here maybe I could have helped stop it.” Regan wished Carol wouldn’t beat herself up so much over every little thing that went wrong. It had been this way since she met Carol. And she knew that it had everything to do with the way Carol was raised. Her parents had been less than supportive. But Regan was fully prepared to make up for the areas in which they had lacked.

“Carol, we had no way of knowing something like this would happen. And you weren’t here because you were helping Talos. Sure, you weren’t there when Thanos attacked. But you’re here now. And you can help them make things right. That’s what matters.” she placed a hand gently on Carol’s shoulder.

Carol nodded, turning over on her side to face Regan. “Do you think things will ever be normal?”

Regan scrunched her nose. “Not a chance,” she said, the both of them chuckling. “But hopefully it’ll be as normal as things can be for a witch and a superhero.”

“I kinda figured our normal days were over once the raccoon started talking,” Carol joked, the pair bursting into a quiet fit of giggles.

“Rocket. You have to start calling him Rocket. He gets really annoyed when people call him the raccoon.”

“Okay, okay. Rocket,” Carol said. She wrapped her arm around Regan’s middle and pulled her closer, resting her forehead against Regan’s. “You know, maybe once all of this is over we can take a break. We can go back home and just enjoy being normal for awhile. Our kind of normal anyways.” she teased.

Regan smiled lightly and nodded. “I’d love that.” Regan had a feeling that there was a possibility Carol and the Avengers were being a bit too firm in the idea that they would stop Thanos. Just like she was unable to speak to those who had disappeared, she was unable to see any sort of vision when it came to the Infinity Gauntlet. But she couldn’t ignore the feeling in her gut.

For now she would just put her confidence in Carol and those that Nick put his trust in. It had to work. Regan wasn’t sure what they would do if it didn’t.

Summary: Regan is a witch living in Louisiana. Her ability to connect with the dead, and a few things from her past, have suddenly made her the Avengers last hope in resolving their issues. But can they help her reconnect with the person she wants to see most?

Pairing: Pre-established Carol Danvers/OC

A/N: So this is obviously where we start getting into Endgame spoiler territory. Before I saw it I wasn’t sure how I would fit Regan into all of this, but now seeing Carol’s story line in the movie I really won’t have to worry much…:)

Carol wasn’t sure how long it had been since she left Earth along with the Skrulls. Time passed by differently for her while she was travelling through the galaxies. It felt like she had barely found a place that she and Talos deemed safe before Skrulls started to disappear right before her eyes with no explanation. Then her beeper went off. Carol was quick to to assume that maybe something similar was happening back on Earth.

She made Talos promise that he would stay put and watch those who had survived while she got to the bottom of things. Nick seemed to be safe at the very least, but the thought of Regan turning to dust sent panic through Carol. She had promised her that she would be back before she knew it, and now there was a chance that she’d never see her again.

The signal was coming from New York. Carol didn’t recognize the building that was standing before her, or the large A that adorned its side. Was this part of SHIELD? Whatever it was it seemed empty. She was quick to take in her surroundings for any sign of danger, but Carol didn’t see a sign of much of anything. It would make getting inside easy at least. No real security. It was a compound of some kind, that much she could tell. Government maybe? Whatever it was, the place was like a ghost town. Someone had to have sent her the distress signal, but now Carol wasn’t sure if there was anyone left for her to help.

“What does that mean? Is it dead?” Carol stopped when she heard the woman’s voice. It was coming from somewhere down the hall. Relief washed over Carol. She walked down the hallway quickly, coming to a large room that she quickly realized was a lab of some kind. There was a group of people with their backs turned towards her…and a raccoon? Carol frowned, her head tilting to the side as she walked up to the group. They were crowded around Nick’s beeper, but there was no Nick in sight.

“…Where’s Nick?” she asked, her head held high. The group turned around almost in perfect sync. Each of them were on high alert and ready to attack. All but one. Carol exhaled slowly. Her arms dropped to her sides. Regan stood at the head of the group. Her long, red hair was tied up in a mess on top of her head and she was in her pajamas for some reason, but she was there. She was safe.

They moved at the same time. In just a few quick strides Carol met Regan at the center of the room. She took Regan’s face in her gloved hands, running her thumb over the witch’s cheek almost as if to make sure she was really there. Regan grasped at Carol’s arms, her eyes brimming with tears. “Sorry I took so long.” Carol breathed, leaning forward and capturing Regan’s lips with her own. Neither of them cared about the group standing there awkwardly watching the display of affection. Carol cared about nothing other than holding onto Regan as tightly as possible, and the salty taste of her tears on her lips.

“…Is that Carol?” someone whispered behind them. Regan laughed lightly, pulling away from Carol finally and turning back to the group.

“Yes, Bruce. This is Carol,” she stood beside the blonde, her hands wrapping around one of Carol’s. ‘And these are the Avengers. They’re with Nick.” she explained. Carol looked over the team briefly, her eyes narrowing a little.

“Where is Nick?” she asked.

Steve gave a passing glance to Natasha, tucking his hands into his pockets awkwardly. “He’s…gone. He was taken with the Snap. He must have had just enough time to send you the signal before he…well, we’re not really sure what’s happened.”

Carol’s jaw clenched for a brief moment. Regan gave her hand a tight squeeze. She wanted to reassure her that everything would be okay. She wanted to tell Carol that they would fix this, and get Nick back. But she couldn’t make that promise. There was a chance that everything wouldn’t be okay. “Who did this?” Carol asked.

“A big purple bastard named Thanos.” it as Rocket that answered.

Carol looked down at him, eyebrows raised in surprise. “You can talk?”

“Of course I can talk. Why’s everyone always so surprised I can talk?” he asked, shooting an incredulous look up at Bruce. Bruce could only shrug.

“I was actually explaining it all to Regan before you got here,” Bruce began. “I can fill you in, get you up to speed. Maybe fill you in on everything you’ve missed while you were gone.” he offered.

Carol shot Regan and Bruce confused looks. “What do you mean? How long could I have been gone?”

“…Twenty four years.” Regan said quietly.

“What?”

“Yeah, this might take awhile…” Bruce mumbled, rubbing the back of his neck.

Regan turned to her, setting her bag down and sitting on the edge of the bed. “I thought I was only gone for a week at the most. A week. And now half of the entire universe is gone? Nick is gone…”

Regan slid into the bed next to Carol, resting her head on her hand. “Please tell me you’re not blaming yourself for this, Carol.”

Carol was silent for a long moment. “…Not entirely. But if I had been here maybe I could have helped stop it.” Regan wished Carol wouldn’t beat herself up so much over every little thing that went wrong. It had been this way since she met Carol. And she knew that it had everything to do with the way Carol was raised. Her parents had been less than supportive. But Regan was fully prepared to make up for the areas in which they had lacked.

“Carol, we had no way of knowing something like this would happen. And you weren’t here because you were helping Talos. Sure, you weren’t there when Thanos attacked. But you’re here now. And you can help them make things right. That’s what matters.” she placed a hand gently on Carol’s shoulder.

Carol nodded, turning over on her side to face Regan. “Do you think things will ever be normal?”

Regan scrunched her nose. “Not a chance,” she said, the both of them chuckling. “But hopefully it’ll be as normal as things can be for a witch and a superhero.”

“I kinda figured our normal days were over once the raccoon started talking,” Carol joked, the pair bursting into a quiet fit of giggles.

“Rocket. You have to start calling him Rocket. He gets really annoyed when people call him the raccoon.”

“Okay, okay. Rocket,” Carol said. She wrapped her arm around Regan’s middle and pulled her closer, resting her forehead against Regan’s. “You know, maybe once all of this is over we can take a break. We can go back home and just enjoy being normal for awhile. Our kind of normal anyways.” she teased.

Regan smiled lightly and nodded. “I’d love that.” Regan had a feeling that there was a possibility Carol and the Avengers were being a bit too firm in the idea that they would stop Thanos.
